mdRecord.dcterms:title: Romeo and Juliet Windmill, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: ...an interesting windmill; Wright christened the structure the "Romeo and Juliet Windmill Tower". Designed in 1886 [sic] to carry water to the Hillside School -- and to withstand some of the area's strongest storms -- critics said it would never remain standing more than 10 years. Romeo (a diamond shaped structure) and Juliet (an octagonal-shaped structure) are locked in an embrace that inspired the moniker. True to the strength of Wright's design and a testament to his engineering genius, the windmill -- although now undergoing renovation to repair damage done by marauding squirrels -- still stands.... -- http://www.franklloydwrightsites.com/wisconsin/springgreen/taliesin/taliesin.htm [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
industrial buildings
weathervanes
